findings.title: DPI - Decimals Precision Inconsistency
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: MRM - Missing Revert Messages
findings.description: The contract is missing error messages. These missing error messages are making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: ULTW - Transfers Liquidity to Team Wallet
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to set the `totalFee` to zero, allowing them to swap the contract's tokens to the native currency and send the swapped amount to the `marketingFeeReceiver`.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates variable even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: RTCI - Reward Token Change Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to change the distribution token address by calling the setRewardToken() method. This may produce several issues in the distribution process.

findings.title: MC - Missing Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape, which may produce vulnerability issues.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if `swapThreshold` is set to a big number or `swapEnabled` is set to false, it can result in significant price volatility due to token price fluctuations.

findings.title: GO - Gas Optimization
findings.description: The `swapThreshold` variable can be set to any amount, including zero, without input validation at the `setSwapBackSettings` function, causing the contract to execute the swap functionality every time a transaction is taking place and consume more gas.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to addresses as part of the transfer flow. If these addresses belong to contracts, they may revert from incoming payment, causing the error to propagate to the token's contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that are initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards, but does not use the `immutable` declaration which can save gas.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set and decrease gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
